quote: Captain's log, Stardate 42881.5.   We are in orbit around Antede   Three, awaiting the arrival of   two dignitaries from this world.
Our mission is to carry them to   a conference on planet Pacifica...
... where their race will be given   the opportunity to join the   Federation.
I thought you might find this   interesting, Mister Crusher. Few   humans have ever seen an Antedian   in the flesh.
Welcome. I'm Jean-Luc Picard,   captain of the Enterprise.
Are they alright, Captain?
No, this is their preferred way   of space travel.
Their physical condition appears   good enough, considering the   circumstances.
It is a self-induced catatonic   state. Their way of dealing with   the trauma of spaceflight.
Will we try to revive them?
Not until we reach the Pacifica   conference. It's three days away.       You've prepared Sickbay facilities   for holding them, Doctor?
As soon as we make some   adjustments. Their physiology   is unusual.       Can you store them for a few   hours?
Aye. I'll have them kept out of   the way here.
What's in this container?
Their food. When they come out   of stasis, they will be very   hungry.
This is what they eat?
In great quantities.
Provide security.
Understood, sir.
What a handsome race.
What did you think of the   Antedians, Wesley?
Well, they are rather   strange-looking, Commander.
Judging a being by its physical   appearance is the last great human   prejudice, Wesley.
A point well taken. I'm sure   that to the Antedians, we're   equally unattractive.
It is interesting to consider just   how subjective "beauty" truly   is...
Captain... we're being hailed by   a small transport vessel just   coming into range.
Oh, my God!
What is the problem?
What can she be doing here?
On the screen, Captain.
Starship Enterprise, come in!
We have you on our viewer, Pilot.
Enterprise... I have a passenger   -- a V.I.P. passenger -- who I'm   ordered to --
Let me talk to them, Pilot. I'm   much more articulate.
Mother!
Captain, we are now receiving   Starfleet orders granting a   Lwaxana....
Lwaxana Troi, daughter of the   Fifth House, Holder of the Sacred   Chalice of Riix, heir to the Holy   Rings of Betazed.
... full ambassadorial status,   sir.
I'm afraid it's back into your   formal uniform, Captain.
And yours too, Commander. She   is listed as representing the   Betazed government at the   conference.
Mother, please don't do this to   me.
Do what to you, Little One?       Oh, what naughty thoughts,   Jean-Luc. How wonderful you still   think of me in that way.
It's so like my mother to do the   unexpected. She's famous for it.
scene: 11   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - PICARD, RIKER AND TROI

quote: It will be nice to have her as   a guest of the Enterprise again.

quote: Where they belong, Mother, Right   under you.

quote: Oh, wonderful. So they are!       But I'll never completely trust   this device, Jean-Luc...
scene: 11   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - PICARD, RIKER AND TROI

quote: He's "Captain Picard," Mother...

quote: Explain.

quote: "Delegates?" The last time I saw   something like this, it was being   served on a plate.

quote: But you, Jean-Luc, I was not aware   you had such handsome legs. My   valet is waiting. You may beam   him aboard now.

quote: You remember Mister Homn, of course.

scene: 11   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - PICARD, RIKER AND TROI

quote: I've retained his services despite   the outlandishly lustful thoughts   he spews in my direction. I   suppose the poor fellow just can't   help himself.

quote: Perhaps you could show me to my   suite now?

quote: Certainly.

quote: I won't interfere with Homn's   duties this time.
scene: 11   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - PICARD, RIKER AND TROI

quote: That's not the real reason,   Jean-Luc. You forget I'm a   telepath.
scene: 11   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - PICARD, RIKER AND TROI

quote: Look, since this apparently has   some meaning to you, Mrs. Troi,   I'll...

quote: ...carry...it.

quote: (trying not to sound     labored)   It's... just down this hall.
He has nice legs too, Little One.   Is he still yours?
Humans no longer own each other   that way, Mother.
Oh really?       That's a custom we may have to   introduce again.
Thank you.
Glad I could help out.
I trust you'll be comfortable   here, Mrs. Troi. Now if you'll   excuse me, I must get back to my   duties.
Captain, I will be serving a   Betazoid dinner of greeting   tonight. It is an ambassadorial   function.
Of course. It, uh, sounds   delightful.
He's a fine man. Solid. Earnest.   Reliable. Perhaps a little on   the dull side, but all in all he's   not bad.
I cannot believe you! You sound   like you're sizing up a commodity.
But that's exactly what men are,   darling. Especially human men.    (chuckles, strokes     Deanna's face)   Was your father ever unhappy with   me?
No, he worshipped you, Mother.   But I'll never learn to see men   the way you do.
You will as you mature, darling.   And the males in your life will   bless you for it.
... but it's true she complimented   Captain Picard on his legs?

quote: I would have thought a telepath   would be more discreet.

scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, WESLEY, WORF, DATA

quote: We must not lose sight of the fact   that we're talking about someone   who has been granted ambassadorial   rank. Even if she appears a bit   eccentric, Lwaxana Troi must be   treated with appropriate respect.   Is that understood?

quote: Our orders on her mentioned   nothing specific except...
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, WESLEY, WORF, DATA

quote: Except what, Mister Data?
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, WESLEY, WORF, DATA

quote: We are to cooperate with her as   fully as possible, deliver her   there untroubled, rested...    (seeing Picard's     expression)   I assume those were merely   courtesies due her rank, sir.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, WESLEY, WORF, DATA

quote: See that every bridge officer and   supervisor has the full text of   that transmission.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, WESLEY, WORF, DATA

quote: Aye, sir.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, WESLEY, WORF, DATA

I'm doing so right now, Captain.

quote: Are they still catatonic?
scene: 20   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - CLOSE ON PULASKI

quote: Status of the beings is unchanged.   Pulse still steady -- respiration   normal for them.
scene: 20   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - CLOSE ON PULASKI

quote: Understood. Keep me informed --   Picard out.
I believe I'll get some rest.       It will be a dress uniform dinner,   gentlemen.
Sir?
Inquiry, Commander: to which   dinner was the captain referring?
Nothing I've been invited to.   Have any of you?
Very interesting!
You're not attending the dinner   with us this evening, Doctor?
I've already eaten, Captain. But   thanks anyway.
Come in!
Tell me Mister Homn, when will the   others be arriving?
The other officers?       Commander Riker? Deanna?
Hello, Jean-Luc. So glad you   could come.
A toast: to Earthmen... who   despite their faults, have a   unique ability to charm women of   all races, in all corners of the   galaxy.
Speaking for the men of Earth,   which is an awesome responsibility   indeed, I thank you.
I know what you're thinking,   Captain.
You do?
You're wondering if I've been   seeing any other man on a serious   basis.
Well actually I wasn't --
-- I wouldn't worry about it,   Jean-Luc.
(reaches out, touches     his hand)   Competition seems to bring out   the best in the human male.
I must admit, I wasn't expecting   this... setting. I assumed that   my high-ranking officers would   also be attending.
Never assume anything when it   comes to Lwaxana Troi. A Betazoid   woman is full of surprises.
Strange, I'm not that hungry   tonight.       I wonder what's making me lose   my appetite? Any ideas?
Oh yes, you're giving thanks for   your food. I'd forgotten about   that.       I wonder how many other cultures   have similar customs.
I don't know.
Let's find out.    (touches his     communicator)   Commander Data.
Yes, Captain.

quote: -- So by using the square root   of pi and then multiplying it by   nine to the third power, I was   able to accurately calculate the   distance between the Omicron   galaxy and the Crab Nebula.
Fascinating, Data. I'm sure Mrs.   Troi would love to hear the one   about the, uh, anomalous chemical   composition of... say... brown   dwarf stars.
Well, not really --
-- Yes Captain, that is a   particularly spellbinding subject.
For most stars, the rare-Earth   element Europium is enriched   relative to samarium and   gadolinium...
Is that so?
It is! However in brown dwarf   stars, the element Europium is   anomalously depleted.
Fascinating.
But that is only the beginning.   If the abundances of the elements   terbium, dysprosium, holmium and   erbium are also factored into the   analysis...
Your mother seems quite an   interesting woman, Deanna.

quote: I see. Is this how you felt when   you first saw me?
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: Well... maybe at first.       But now that I've seen a few more   Klingons, I know that you're real   handsome, for... for a Klingon.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: That uh, didn't come out quite   right.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: I still say they'd look better   in sauce.    (moves closer;     concentrating)   No, nothing.       When will the good captain revive   them?
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: Not until we reach Pacifica,   ma'am.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: You seem a fine boy. One day you   will grow up to be a big, strong   man.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: But even though humans age far   more rapidly than Betazoids, I   cannot afford to wait for you to   mature.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: But you... your innermost thoughts   are primal, savage. I like that   in a man.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: I am not a man.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: Which is in your favor, men so   often being irrational and   egotistical.       But I'm afraid I've grown   accustomed to human companionship.   It's nothing personal, you would   have made a fine choice.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: Who's next, Mister Homn?
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: Ah yes. Let's get to it, I'm not   getting any younger.
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: What was that all about?
scene: 51   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WESLEY AND WORF

quote: Lieutenant La Forge, I wish to   be direct with you.
I prefer it that way. Now what   are you being direct about?
I have decided to give all the   bridge officers an equal   opportunity to gain my favor.
I see.
Ah, but you don't, and that's the   problem. I wonder whether a   sightless man could ever   appreciate great beauty.
That's funny... I've always had   the same doubts about the sighted.
Odd. How so?

Because my eyes don't seduce my   mind, I'm driven to find beauty   in other things -- things sighted   people tend to ignore. The lovely   temperature gradiations of bodies,   the moisture patterns, the   indications of inner peace and   harmony...
Very interesting, Lieutenant. But   I'm not sure if that's good or   bad. A less perceptive man could   be easier to live with.
Twenty dollars a day, plus   expenses. Fifty when I find her.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: You know it's wonderful to need   money.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: You'll get more when you find   Alva.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: Let's see... I must have been   skimming pages about here. What   part did you play?
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: Freeze.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: Ah, yes, of course.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: I'm looking for Slade Bender,   Hill. I understand he was here   yesterday.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: My, my, time does fly in the   Holodeck.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: Even if I happen to know a Slade   Bender, why should I help you?
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: Because he owes me money. And   because if you don't, I'll blow   your head off.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: I knew you'd say something like   that. Marvelous.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: Cut the crap, Hill! Tell me where   he is or so help me, I'll plug   ya!
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: I don't think so.
scene: 57   INT. END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE - PICARD
location: END OF HALLWAY OUTSIDE HILL'S OFFICE

quote: Come on, drop! I shot ya.
scene: 59   INT. CHANDLERLAND HALLWAY - PICARD AND TOUGHGUY

quote: No, the gun misfired. Thankfully   the Holodeck is handling it   correctly and the mortality   failsafe is functional.
scene: 59   INT. CHANDLERLAND HALLWAY - PICARD AND TOUGHGUY

quote: But in some ways, the program is   almost too accurate.
scene: 59   INT. CHANDLERLAND HALLWAY - PICARD AND TOUGHGUY

quote: Dixon, you're hurt!
scene: 59   INT. CHANDLERLAND HALLWAY - PICARD AND TOUGHGUY

quote: Don't worry about it.       I'm going out for a drink.
scene: 59   INT. CHANDLERLAND HALLWAY - PICARD AND TOUGHGUY

quote: Well hello, Dixon. Haven't seen   you in a while.
What's it been, four hours?
You must be Rex. Am I right?
If you gotta ask me that pal, you   need a drink.
You're right, I do need a drink.
The usual?
Let's see... Scotch, neat?
What else?       I hate to be the bearer of bad   news old buddy, but you're leakin'   blood.
So? I've got plenty more where   that came from.
Geez, Dix. You're tough as   nails.
Uggh, I'm going to have to get   used to that.
Yeah, it's only your third one   today.
What the hell... make it four.
I'll put it on your tab.
Cash! I just took on a case.
Bridge this is Doctor Pulaski.   We have completed the transfer.   The Antedians are now in Sickbay.
Acknowledged, Doctor.       E.t.a. to Pacifica, Mister Crusher?
Twelve point four hours, sir.   That will get us there   approximately two hours before   the conference begins.
Mother, what are you doing here?   You can't just stroll up to the   bridge whenever you feel like it.
I didn't just stroll up, dear.   I took the turbotube, or whatever   you call it.       The captain's not here?
He's busy elsewhere, ma'am.
Well, no matter. I have other   interests as well.
You're scheming something, Mother.   I can tell.
You're always so melodramatic,   Little One. I'm not scheming,   I'm deciding.
Tell me Commander... what is your   opinion of Betazoid women?
Well... I've only your daughter   and you. But judging from that,   I'd have to say they're the   fairest in the galaxy.
He has excellent taste, Little   One.
That's enough! This is getting   embarrassing.
My lovely daughter has always   found it difficult to accept   compliments from male admirers.   I however, long ago learned to   accept them.
The key is learning how to endure   constant flattery without letting   it go to your head. Don't you   agree, Commander?
If you say so, ma'am.
I like that answer! Now here's   a man who knows how to defer to   a lady. I only hope the rest of   you men are listening.
... So she says "Rex, when are   you gonna sell the bar and get   a real job? Make a shoe, mend   a fence, do something useful?"   Can you believe that, Dix?
It's hard to believe, Rex.
She just doesn't understand the   service I perform here. My   regulars depend on me to pour and   listen, listen and pour. I'm like   some kind'a psychologist to you   guys, am I right?
I recognize the size of the   shadow.
(speaking, without     turning around)   Hello Slade. Buy you a drink?
Where's my Alva?
I'm working on it.
(grabbing Picard's     shoulders)   You're not working hard enough.
Hey pal, that's my buddy you're   manhandling there! Maybe you   oughta --
-- Oughta go right ahead with what   you were saying.
I paid you money, Hill. Where   is she?
The blood chemistry and brain   organization of these creatures   is completely outside of my   experience... But it seems their   metabolic rates are increasing.
Is that good or bad?
It's good, I think.
Pulaski to bridge.
Riker here.
The Antedians are coming around.   They're currently in the early   stages of post-hibernation.
How long before they're fully   conscious?
I'd guess it to be a matter of   hours now.
Very good, Doctor, I'll notify   the captain. Riker out.       If you'll excuse me, ma'am.
Are you going to see the captain?   I thought he was tied up on   ship's business.
In a manner of speaking... he is.   I'm uh, not going to interrupt   him, I'm simply going to inform   him.
What excellent timing! You can   also inform him about us.
Us?
You don't mind if I let your   bridge crew know first, do you   William?
(continuing, to     everyone)   Dear friends... you're all invited   to a prestigious occasion on the   planet Pacifica.
Oh no.
There, on the shores of the   western sea... in a traditional   Betazoid ceremony... your   Commander Riker and I will be   joined in the union of holy   wedlock.
Married?
'Till death do us part.
Mrs. Troi... I don't know how to   put this --
-- I know just how you feel, dear.       Overwhelmed with excitement.   Believe me, I understand.
We'll talk about the details   later. Right now, there are   preparations to be made.
Why did you stop me? Someone   needs to set her straight!
I'd rather let the captain handle   that.
Coward!
Simply following Starfleet's   orders. Keep her mind untroubled   until the conference.
Are you planing on going into the   Holodeck, Commander?
Thought I might, Data. Want to   come along?
I have mastered the language, or   "lingo" of the period, sir. Also,   the mannerisms and body language.
scene: 74   INT. HALLWAY LEADING TO HOLODECK - MATCHING CUT

quote: For example, this is a gesture   denoting confidence and physical   prowess. It is effective in   attracting females and frightening   off would-be adversaries.
scene: 74   INT. HALLWAY LEADING TO HOLODECK - MATCHING CUT

quote: Should anything in there confuse   you sir, do not hesitate to ask.
scene: 74   INT. HALLWAY LEADING TO HOLODECK - MATCHING CUT

quote: It's comforting to know I'm with   an expert Data, but we're really   not going to be there that long.       Computer...
scene: 74   INT. HALLWAY LEADING TO HOLODECK - MATCHING CUT

quote: She could be anywhere, Slade.   You can't expect me to find her   in one afternoon.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: It's been three days.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Has it really? What I mean is   -- you gotta have patience. I'll   find her; I guarantee it.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: (earnest, almost     child-like)   She'd contact me if she knew I   was lookin' for her.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Come on, pal! So she told you   that? So what? If I had a dime   for every time a dame's said that   to a guy --
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: -- I'd... probably have less than   a dollar. Cuz a girl never says   that unless she really means it.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: See? I want you to find my   sister!
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: In the last program here, we said   I was from South America. It   seemed to explain my unorthodox   appearance.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Easy Slade. They're friends of   mine.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Sorry to bother you, Captain.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: -- Call me Dixon.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: -- Sorry to bother you, Dixon,   but our two "passengers" are   awakening.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Well then, it's time to go.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Your friends've got time for one   drink, haven't they Dix?
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Sure, I can afford another round.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Very accurate. Fascinating.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: These are my associates...       "Nails", from Chicago.       And --
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Carlos, from South America.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Sit right down fellas, and tell   me your troubles.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: Troubles I've got, sir. There's   a certain woman, a wealthy and   beautiful woman, who suddenly says   she's going to marry me.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: She's got looks and bucks? Sounds   like you've got yourself a heck   of a deal.
scene: 76   INT. REX'S BAR - SAME SETTING AS BEFORE

quote: My fiance just has to see how I   look in this. Come along, Homn.
scene: 77   INT. MRS. TROI'S QUARTERS - MRS. TROI (OPTICAL)

quote: Tell me, computer, is Commander   Riker still on the bridge?
Negative. Riker is currently in   Holodeck Three.
Holodeck? Where is that?
Follow the com panel lights. They   will lead you there.
Good God, what's that?
I'll bet that's the broad with   the big bucks!       Come on over here, darlin'. I   got the best stool in the house   saved for ya.
I'm surprised you let this part   of the ship get this dirty.
Actually, that's the first   officer's job.
Well, as a matter of fact...
Relax, Commander. You have begun   making your true feelings clear.   Obviously you feel unable to   handle me.
Anyway, why would a beautiful   high-class lady like yourself...       ... want to hook up with a mug like   that? You're too good for him,   if you ask me.
I couldn't agree more.
So... what'llitbe, Doll?
You are a most interesting person.
You're not so bad yourself. In   fact, you're as much class as this   joint's ever seen.
Here -- on the house. It's   French... well, almost.
This is the most remarkable man.   I have never met anyone quite   like him.
I don't suppose you have.
He's strong. I feel no thoughts   from him... nothing. I've never   known a man so able to keep his   true feelings completely hidden.
That's because...
No man has ever been such a   mystery to me. I usually know   their thoughts before they do.
But not me, huh?
No. And I never realized how   erotic that could be. Carry my   beverage to that table... we have   some things to talk about.
Should we tell her?
I think it's only fair, but let's   allow her the moment.
Food-food-food-food-food--
Worf! The vermicula!
Pulaski to Captain Picard.
Go ahead, Doctor.
Our passengers are on their feet.
Understood.
I had better get to the bridge.
What's their condition?
Hungry.
Coming, Mrs. Troi?
Not just yet. Tell William I'm   sorry... but Rex and I are   getting married.
Mrs. Troi, your government expects   us to deliver you to the   conference and I intend to do   that!
Duty calls, darling. I'll be back   for you later.
There is something about Rex I   think you had better know...
Imagine -- allowing me to go on   like that with a simple bartender   who doesn't even exist!
Mother, you always say you like   new experiences.
Why are they still here?
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: We thought that since you're going   to the same conference, you might   like to beam down with the other   delegates.
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: They're not delegates. Those two   are assassins.
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: That is... an outrage!... Lies!   We demand you... transport at   once!
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: Oh honey, don't bother to deny   it. Your minds are so   unsophisticated -- I can read your   thoughts in my sleep.       The inside of their robes are   lined with ultritium. Highly   explosive and virtually   undetectable by your transporter.
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: She is correct, sir. I am   detecting large amounts of   ultritium.
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: Of course you are. They planned   to blow up the entire conference.
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: Take them to level five. Disarm   them and hold for questioning.
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: Oh well, I didn't find a mate but   I saved the conference as well   as your reputations. All in a   day's work I suppose.
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: Good-bye Mrs. Troi... and thank   you.
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)

quote: Jean-Luc! Shame on you for   thinking such a thing!
scene: 89   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - THE TROI ENTOURAGE (OPTICAL)
